intro: Cyclopogon hennisianus, commonly known as the Hennisian cyclopogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This species is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive inflorescence structure. The plant typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
